conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, C, and D) as it interacts with the baffles.
There are four sources labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the image.
Below these sources, there are several baffles (colored bars) that will direct the flow of the liquid.
At the bottom, there are two containers labeled E and F.
The liquid from source A flows down and hits the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the yellow liquid to the left, where it encounters the green baffle.
The green baffle further directs the liquid towards the left side, ultimately leading it to container E.
The liquid from source B flows down and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the cyan liquid towards the right, where it encounters the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid further to the right, leading it towards container F.
The liquid from source C flows down and hits the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the pink liquid towards the right, where it encounters the pink baffle.
The pink baffle directs the liquid further to the right, leading it towards container F.
The liquid from source D flows down and hits the pink baffle.
The pink baffle directs the blue liquid towards the right, where it encounters the black baffle.
The black baffle directs the liquid further to the right, leading it towards container F.
After analyzing the paths, the yellow liquid from source A flows into container E.
After analyzing the paths, the cyan, pink, and blue liquids from sources B, C, and D flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into container F after passing through the baffles.
